intro: Cheiranthus caboverdeanus, commonly known as the Cape Verde wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the arid and saline conditions of its native habitat. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
